events.name: MPA Smart Port Hackathon 2015 Workshop
events.description: The workshop is a great opportunity for you to get a head start on the Smart Port Hackathon 2015 , which will bring together a myriad of stakeholders from across the maritime supply chain. Hear from industry professionals and experts, as they describe the issues they face at every step of the supply chain. Explore how Big Data can be applied to build solutions that empower these stakeholders. Get a sense of the kind of technology-enabled tools that will help integrate the members of the supply chain, and create synergies among them. You can use all these insights when you're building solutions over the hackathon weekend! Agenda: 7pm - Welcome by MPA 7.10pm - Intro to challenges and datasets and various talks 8.40pm - Bluemix workshop 10pm - End Best Bluemix App prizes for open and student category!
events.location: LT4, Block T4A, Level 1, Singapore Polytechnic, 500 Dover Road

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 5th Aug 2015 7:00pm
events.description: Introduction to Next Generation of Azure PaaS – Service Fabric (via Skype) By Vishwas LeleCTO, Applied Information Sciences and Microsoft Regional Director Description At the recently concluded Microsoft BUILD conference, Azure team announced their vision for the next generation of PaaS platform – Azure Service Fabric. Azure Service Fabric provides a high control platform that enables developers and ISVs to build cloud services with a high degree of scalability and customization. Service Fabric was born from Microsoft’s years of experience delivering mission-critical cloud services and has been in production for more than five years. It provides the foundational technology upon which Azure’s core infrastructure is ran and also powers services like Skype for Business, InTune, Event Hubs, DocumentDB, Azure SQL Database (across more than 1.4 million customer databases) and Bing Cortana – which can scale to process more than 500 million evaluations per second. About Speaker Vishwas Lele serves as CTO at Applied Information Sciences, Inc. Mr Lele is responsible for assisting organizations in envisoning, designing and implementing enterprise solutions related cloud and mobility. Mr Lele brings close to 25 years of experience and thought leadership to his position, and has been with AIS for 20 years. A noted industry speaker and author, Mr. Lele serves as the Microsoft Regional Director for Washington D.C. and is currently a Microsoft Azure MVP.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Open House:  100th Year Anniversary of Datwyler & SG50
events.description: To celebrate Datwyler 100th Year Anniversary and SG50, we invite you to come to Datwyler Open House on Aug 6 at any time between 11am to 5pm. This is to be held on the eve of long SG national holiday from Aug 7-10. We will provide tour to its facility (office, demo room, warehouse, workshop). Datwyler is the Swiss manufacturer of structured cabling and elevator cabling. Singapore has been the logistics hub for Asia since 1996. Datwyler is among few reputable MNCs that have its own full-fledged operation to support customers. We handles orders, warehousing, delivery, customer services by ourselves. Each product that we ship out is 100% tested and not merely pass sampling test. Each local staff has been well-trained towards Swiss quality of product, innovation and customer services. The Open House is to give a rare opportunity for you to look & feel its facility. You may come anytime between 11am to 5pm on Thu, Aug 6, and spend whatever time you prefer. We invite you to join lunch or drinks together with us. Then we will give you a tour to our facility and demo room. If time is permitted for you, you could join some talks from us and our partners on data centre technologies, structured cabling, GPON, Wireless Access Point system, data centre physical security system, fire protection, and so on. For those tech entrepreneurs who like to seek business opportunities in data centre, structured cabling, wireless, networking, we will provide a talk on how we can provide resources and supports for you. You will receive a special edition of celebration gift from Datwtyler.
events.location: Datwyler, 30 Toh Guan Road #01-01A (Opp IMM, near Furniture Mall).  , Singapore

events.name: Aug/2015 - Open Space (Culture)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Rohit Arora from Barclays Open Space Theme: Culture Rohit: When you’re trying to introduce Agile Project Development into your company or to a new team, it’s important that you know how to make it work. More than the terms, practices, meetings and user stories, the Agile Mindset keeps the team on point and helps them self-manage even if they aren’t too familiar with the terms used in Agile. But what is a Mindset? Why is this more important than the terms and practices of Agile on the habitual and personal level? Essentially a mindset is a culture that you implement with the incentive to accept or adopt the cultural norms. If you want to truly implement Agile, it has to become a part of your company’s culture. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) . Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room. Someone from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he/she will make the trip are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm There is no guarantee of trips after 7:45pm.
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: JS Beginner Study Group
events.description: It has been voted! Our weekly meetup will take place every Thursday 7 - 9pm . This study group is meant for absolute beginners and those who have used a teeny bit of JS before (JS rails gems anyone?). Join us for a session of discussion and some practical work afterwards. Bring your laptops and do your homework (or at least attempt to ;p) before the sesh. **This week, we will be starting on: "You Don't Know JS: Up & Going" - http://bit.ly/1IeTNUq Please try to read all 3 chapters for the discussion. **Join our chat channel: #milo-dinosaur on Kopi.JS Slack - http://kopijs.herokuapp.com/
events.location: Drury Lane Cafe,  94 Tanjong Pagar Rd, Singapore

events.name: Meet And Code
events.description: For coding fanatic, meet up and share coding experience the projects that you are work, the latest in programming language network and explore more! Let me and code together!
events.location: Thomson Plaza , 301 Upper Thomson Rd Singapore 574408

events.name: Data Mining With R (Workshop III)
events.description: Hello everyone, the upcoming Data Mining with R workshop will be talking about clustering with iterative process. Clustering can be considered the most important unsupervised learning problem. The goal of clustering is to determine the intrinsic grouping in a set of unlabeled data. In this talk, Teck Por will be showing three clustering algorithms with iterative process: K-means clustering, EM clustering and kernel K-means clustering. After the introduction of the 3 popular clustering algorithms, he will also share his experience on fine tuning the parameters to address real problems, such as determine the number of clusters. Of course, in the end, the code walkthrough session will also give you an idea of how to apply these algorithms with R.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: UNited We Hack
events.description: Always wanted to put your mad coding skills to do some good? Women’s earnings are, on average, 24% lower than men’s in developed countries. The difference is even starker in developing economies. Be part of the movement as we gather brightest minds to use the latest APIs and create innovative solutions to empower women & improve gender equality! On August 15th and 16th, join us at Microsoft Singapore for a 24 hour hackathon to innovate in the field of women’s financial and economic empowerment. This hackathon is open to men and women who are interested in using the latest API’s to create cutting edge solutions around gender equity and financial equality. Tickets are FREE at http://unitedwehack.com/ Winning teams would not only receive cash prizes but also gain access to incubation & mentorship programmes, ensuring that your ideas are brought to the real world! Join us to be part of an amazing cause! Come even if you only want to look at the pretty judges.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.description: For the August meetup we will visit Wego, a travel search site headquartered in Singapore. Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at Wego ship code. 7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks 7:15pm — Intro talk by the host 7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new 9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned 9:30pm — The end. There will be guest wifi, food & drinks provided. Address: 100 Beach Road #23-07/13 Shaw Tower Singapore 189702 Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time.

events.description: Have you ever come across something new in front end, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper. Front End TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop. For the August meetup we will visit Wego , a travel search site headquartered in Singapore. Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at Wego ship code. 7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks 7:15pm — Intro talk by the host 7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new 9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned 9:30pm — The end. There will be guest wifi, food & drinks provided. Address: Wego Shaw Tower 100 Beach Road #23-07/13 Singapore 189702 Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/

events.name: talk.js
events.description: The next talk.js will be on Tuesday August 18th. Scheduled Talks: • The Imitation Game: Redux - Jacky Boen • How I build a static site generator with Gulp - Zell Liew Lightning Talks: • Sails.js - João Bentes Leave a comment or message us if you'd like to give a talk! Location: PayPal Singapore Suntec Tower 55 Temasek Boulevard #09-01 Singapore Venue, free drinks and pizza sponsored by PayPal. Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions See you there!
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: August Drupal Meetup: Automated Testing
events.description: This coming August, Joe Chin will be presenting about automated testing using Behat. Note: This session is more suitable for developers, so if you're looking at improving your developer skills and talk shop with other developers about Drupal, come by! For individuals who are just keen to find out more about Drupal or looking to hire a Drupal expert, come by around 7pm for the networking and food first. This is where you can find out more about Drupal. Agenda: 7pm – 7:45pm: Networking, chit chat, food 7:45 – 8:30pm: Presentation by Joe Chin 8:30 – 9pm: Q&A, developers talk shop, networking For any questions, please feel free to post it in the comments below! See ya all!

events.description: • "Exceptions...WTF?!" by Simon Hengel • 101 talk on "Polymorphic types" by Paul Meng • [Melvin's talk has been retracted.]

events.name: First Meetup
events.description: Our first meetup will be Open Space Style. No agenda in particular. Everyone is free to propose topics including topics you like to discuss on our future meetups. Lightning talks of 2 to 5 minutes on any talking-points are welcome. Ideally I like to discuss issues we’ve encountered and more importantly share on how we’ve fixed them. Knowledge sharing.
events.location: PropertyGuru, 51 Goldhill Plaza #11-03 (circular building next to United Square), Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: Ryoji Ikeda: Supercodex Thursday 20 August, 8pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 Tickets: $12/$10 (students). Purchase here: http://bit.ly/1HB0JQP Concept, composition: Ryoji Ikeda Computer graphics, programming: Tomonaga Tokuyama PREPARE TO BE IMMERSED IN A MULTI-SENSORIAL EXTRAVAGANZA. Sonic artist, visual artist, electronic composer and computer-musician in one, Ryoji Ikeda has gained international renown for his provocative work combining visuals and sound. ArtScience Museum is delighted to host the performance of Ikeda’s supercodex [live set], which reworks musical concepts from Ikeda’s 2013 superposition piece, which investigates how we understand the reality of nature on an atomic scale, taking its starting point in mathematical models and quantum mechanics. supercodex [live set] begins subtly, with digital noise, blips and bass drones, from which gradually emerges the core elements of techno and dance music, where Ikeda uses raw data and mathematical models to generate music and projections. Don’t miss this extraordinary live performance, where the accompanying visuals add to the rich textures to merge the senses, creating an unforgettable experience. For more information please visit: http://www.ryojiikeda.com/archive/concerts/#supercodex_live_set Part of the Soundislands Festival http://soundislands.com/si15/

events.name: A joint meetup with Singapore Network Engineering.
events.description: We will talk about below topics: • rDNS • LACP • GPON And demo using MikroTik hardware, after all this is MikroTik User Group :)
events.location: SiS Building, 4 Leng Kee Road #03-03, Singapore

events.name: Customize your 3D Printed Sunglasses?
events.description: Did you know we are starting a new line of 3D Printed eyewear? Are you interested to customize one?

events.name: Conversations: “~sound:senses”
events.description: “~sound:senses” Saturday 22nd August 2015 2.15pm to 5.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE What is the colour of sound? Does the shape of the plate change the taste of the cake? This August, join us as leading artists and scientists in the fields of psychology, sound art, perception, and multimodal design come together to explore how sound acts as the glue connecting our sensorial experiences and interactions. Guest speakers include luminaries such as interaction designer, Stefania Serafin, crossmodality researcher Charles Spence, composer Joyce Beetuan Koh, filmmaker Daniel Belton, and psycholinguist Suzy Styles. Chairing the panel is ArtScience Museum Executive Director, Honor Harger. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, initiated by PerMagnus Lindborg with support from CLASS and ADM at Nanyang Technological University, the Italian Institute of Culture, and the Arts Council of New Zealand.

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Sunday 23rd August 2015 10am to 6.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE “~sound:senses” Sound is the medium that acts as the glue between the senses, intertwining hearing, vision and movement. This Sunday Showcase, we invite you to dive into a coral reef of artworks and scientific demonstrations by international artists and researchers who have mapped out crossmodal associations with touch, smell, feel, and taste. “~sound:senses” will feature sound installations, experimental films, robotic sculptures, mobile media, web audio solutions, as well as workshops on electroacoustic sounds led by experts. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, with support from Nanyang Technological University.

events.name: SARTS Monthly Meeting - August 2015
events.description: This is our regular monthly meeting, join us to learn more about Amateur Radio and our activities!

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (August)
events.description: How is everyone feeling after RDRC? As we approach the third-quarter of the year, it's time to start consolidating and practising what we've learnt! As usual, we will have a structured workshop syllabus to facilitate learning for the beginners. For those who have been attending our meetups regularly and/or know the basics of Ruby on Rails, our flexibility will still be there. If you'd like to work on your project or run through concepts/material with guidance, our coaches are more than happy to help and answer your questions. We love the enthusiasts! Come and join us at the August Rails Girls meetup! Agenda: • 10:00 - 10:15 Registration • 10:15 - 10:20 Introduction • 10:20 - 10:30 Break into groups • 10:30 - 13:00 Start to code ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please contact Nathania (nathaniawong89@gmail.com) and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Sherwyn - Ted - Sai - Aravindh - Lachlan Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Winston (winston.yongwei@gmail.com).

events.name: Papers We Love #012
events.description: Paper #1 - Worker/Wrapper/Makes It/Faster: Laurence Day : http://www.cs.nott.ac.uk/~jph/wwmf.pdf Paper #2 - Robust Range-Only Beacon Localization : Ashish Raste - https://people.csail.mit.edu/teller/pubs/robl.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: Gazelle Twin and Special Guests 10 Sep, Thu, 7pm to 10pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 FREE This ArtScience Late, for the first time in Asia, FutureEverything Singapore will present unique performances from UK artist Gazelle Twin, and new Singaporean music and audio visual talents. Fresh from their appearance at 2015 FutureEverything Festival in Manchester, standout British artist, composer and producer Elizabeth Bernholz will perform as her alter ego, Gazelle Twin. Performing works from her seminal album, ‘Unflesh’, this evening promises to be highly visual with challenging visions of “horror-pop”. Joining Gazelle Twin will be a carefully curated selection of audio visual and electronic artists from Singapore to present an evening of the most innovative and imaginative breaking sounds from the UK and Singapore underground. FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 11th Sep 2015 7:00pm
events.description: Details coming soon
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already. After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you. Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that. Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week! What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. ** DISCLAIMER **: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!
